ygData.subject: Re: [archive-crawler] Change number of ToeThread of a running job
ygData.msgSnippet: Hi, Heritrix3 gracefully adjusts the number of ToeThreads in response to the change of maxToeThreads property value while running. So you can just run

Subject: Re: [archive-crawler] Change number of ToeThread of a running job
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=264138474; y=9ZGFLoThbXMlg_3okQqSW0-m2I_kDqOAEufCfobsGfFB5A
X-Yahoo-Profile: kenznag
From: Kenji Nagahashi <knagahashi@...>

Hi,

Heritrix3 gracefully adjusts the number of ToeThreads in response to the 
change of maxToeThreads property value while running.

So you can just run something like this Groovy script:

job.crawlController.maxToeThreads = 150;

This is also useful to bring back ToeThreads that died because of 
unhandled exception.

--Kenji

https://github.com/netarchivesuite/heritrix3-scripts/blob/master/src/main/java/nas.groovy
https://github.com/netarchivesuite/heritrix3-scripts/blob/master/src/main/java/nas.groovy
On 4/19/16 12:19 AM, Colin Rosenthal csr@... 
[archive-crawler] wrote:
> I have a sample script for killing a toe thread (by number) here:
> https://github.com/netarchivesuite/heritrix3-scripts/blob/master/src/main/java/nas.groovy
>
> I haven't looked into "gracefully" altering the number of toe threads -
> either up or down.
>
> regards,
> Colin Rosenthal
>
> On 04/16/2016 01:34 PM, pierz@... [archive-crawler] wrote:
>  > Hi,
>  >
>  >
>  > I did launch a job, I want to know if I can change the ToeThread
> number while the job is running ? How ?
>  >
>  >
>  > Best regards
>
>
